plugins.name: AdaptaFont—Intelligent Font Scaling for Seamless Multi-Format Scenarios
plugins.description:
1. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Image Dimension Requirements

Automatically adjusts text font size by modifying the fixed width and line count parameters according to different image dimension needs (e.g., designs for multiple e-commerce platforms), enabling rapid completion of typesetting in such scenarios.


2. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Language Requirements

Through configuring font family, font weight, and line height settings, the plugin automatically adjusts font sizes for text content in various languages to adapt to the preset text width and line count, thereby quickly fulfilling typesetting requirements for globalized designs.


Features:


⌨️ Methods to Obtain Text:

Designers can acquire text content requiring adaptive font sizes either by selecting text nodes or inputting/pasting new text in the plugin's input field.


🔄 Reacquire Text Content & Text Properties:

Designers can click the refresh button to reacquire the text content, font, font weight, and line height of selected text layers on the canvas for further adjustments and optimization.


👀 Predict Actual Line Count:

The plugin features actual line count prediction capability, forecasting real line numbers based on current text content and settings to help designers better plan text layout.


↙️ Window Scaling:

The plugin window can be minimized by collapsing setting items, proving highly efficient in scenarios requiring rapid multi-language text replacement using identical text properties.


🎨 Theme Switching & Language Toggling

Switch between light/dark themes

Instant Chinese/English interface language switching


---

1. 不同图片尺寸需求的文本字号自适应

根据不同的图片尺寸需求，通过调整文本的固定宽度及行数，自动调整文本的字号，快速完成在如多电商平台的设计中排版。


2. 不同语言需求的文本字号自适应

插件通过设置字体、字重、行高，自动调整各个语言下文本内容的字号来适配设置好的文本宽度和行数，以此来快速完成全球化设计的排版需求。


功能：


⌨️ 获取文本的方式

设计师可以通过选择文本节点，或者在插件输入框中输入或粘贴新文本来获取需要自适应字号的文本内容。


🔄 重新获取文本内容与文本属性

设计师可点击刷新按钮，重新获取画布中已选中的文本图层的文本内容、字体、字重和行高，以便进一步的调整和优化。


👀 预测实际行数

插件具备实际行数预测功能，能够根据当前文本内容和设置，预测实际的行数，帮助设计师更好地规划文本的排版。


↙️ 窗口缩放

可通过折叠设置项来缩小插件窗口，这在使用同一套文本属性的多语言文本快速替换场景下十分高效。


🎨 主题切换与中英文切换
plugins.tagline: AdaptaFont auto-sizes text in Figma by width, line height & max lines.

plugins.name: Populate JSON data
plugins.description:
✨ JSON-to-Design Plugin

🚀 Supercharge Your Design Workflow


Bring your templates to life with data-driven automation! The JSON-to-Design Plugin allows you to effortlessly populate and duplicate designs using simple JSON files.


Key Features


✅ Upload JSON Files

Supports two formats:


  1. Array format: Automatically duplicates selected designs for each object in the array while replacing placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}.


{
"array": [
{ "name": "John", "surname": "Doe" },
{ "name": "Emma", "surname": "Walker" },
{ "name": "Liam", "surname": "Harris" }
]
}


  1. Object format: Updates a single design with JSON values without duplication.


{
"name": "John",
"surname": "Doe"
}


✅ Dynamic Placeholder Replacement

Replace {{name}}, {{surname}}, or other placeholders in text elements with real data—seamlessly integrate information into your designs.


✅ Save Time and Effort

Eliminate repetitive manual tasks by automating data entry and duplication. Perfect for projects requiring consistent layouts with unique data sets.


How to Use

🎯 Follow these simple steps to get started:


Upload Your JSON File

Upload a correctly formatted JSON file using the plugin. Choose between the array format or object format depending on your use case.

Select the Layer

Highlight the Figma layer containing text objects with placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}. Ensure these placeholders are named correctly.

Click “Populate Design”

Let the plugin work its magic! It will duplicate designs or populate data based on your JSON file.


💡 Tip: Double-check placeholder names in your design to match JSON keys for smooth operation.


Why Choose JSON-to-Design?


💡 Smart Automation: Unlike other plugins, this tool simplifies both duplication and data replacement in one intuitive flow.

⏱ Time-Saving Magic: Whether you’re working with a few data points or hundreds, let the plugin handle the heavy lifting while you focus on creativity.
plugins.tagline: The plugin allows you to upload a JSON file and, based on it, populate designs with this data.

plugins.name: AutoFrame
plugins.description:
AutoFrame: Connect Airtable Data to Your Figma Designs


Bridge the gap between your data and your designs! Autoframe allows you to seamlessly connect your Airtable bases directly to Figma, automating the creation and synchronization of design elements.


Stop manually copying and pasting data. With Autoframe, you can generate perfectly structured Figma frames populated with real content from your Airtable views, saving you time and reducing errors.


Key Features:

  1. Secure Airtable Connection: Easily connect your Airtable account using a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.
  2. Automated Frame Generation: Select an Airtable Base, Table, and View, and instantly generate Figma frames for each record.
  3. Data-Driven Content: Choose specific Airtable fields to populate text layers within your frames, ensuring your designs reflect your actual data.
  4. Custom Frame Naming: Designate an Airtable field to automatically name your generated frames.
  5. Dynamic Frame Sizing: Optionally add a "Dimensions" field (e.g., 300x500) in your Airtable view to automatically set the width and height of corresponding Figma frames.
  6. Flexible Layout: Control the arrangement of generated frames by specifying the number of columns.
  7. Figma to Airtable: Push text edits or frame name changes made in Figma back to your Airtable base.
  8. Airtable to Figma: Pull the latest data from Airtable to update your existing generated frames without needing to regenerate everything.
  9. Secure Login: Protects access via an Email + One-Time Passcode (OTP) verification system.


How It Works:

  1. Connect: Log in and securely connect your Airtable account.
  2. Select: Choose your Airtable Base, Table, View, and the fields you want to use for frame names and content.
  3. Generate: Click "Generate Frames" to automatically create frames on your Figma canvas populated with your data.
  4. Sync: Use the "Sync Changes to Airtable" or "Sync From Airtable" buttons to keep your designs and data aligned.


Ideal For:

  1. Data-driven design workflows
  2. Managing dynamic content within designs (e.g., user profiles, product cards)
  3. Populating components for design systems
  4. Quickly visualizing data structures from Airtable
  5. Anyone looking to streamline their design process by integrating directly with Airtable.


Get started with AutoFrame today and bring your Airtable data to life in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Autoframe: The Bridge Between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.name: Figma to PowerFX theme converter
plugins.description:
Easily transform your Figma variables into reusable themes for Power Apps with our plugin. Figma to Power FX theme converter is a tool for Power Apps designers and developers who want to streamline their workflow and save time.


Key Features:

  1. Automated Conversion: All the variables in your Figma file are automatically translates into Power FX variables while maintaining the Figma hierarchy.
  2. Collection selection: Choose the collection you want to convert into Power FX.
  3. Color Format: Choose the color format you prefer to use between RGBA and Hexadecimal


We are continuously working on improving the plugin and plan to add new parameters for even more customization in future versions.
plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma variables into themes for use in your Power Apps

The WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker plugin designed to help you ensure that your design system components comply with SC 1.4.4: Resize Text (Level AA). This plugin helps verify that all text elements within your Figma designs behave appropriately when resized to 200% of their original size.


Key features:

  1. 200% text resize: duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.
  2. All component checking: works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line height adjustments: allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.

plugins.name: ContentFlow
plugins.description:
ContentFlow is the ultimate text manager for Figma, designed to keep designs, copy, and teams perfectly aligned. Whether you want to gather and review edits before updating your designs or streamline developer handoff, this plugin simplifies every aspect of text management.


Here’s what you can expect:

  1. ⏳ Postpone Text Updates: Accumulate edits without immediately applying them—batch updates or finalize them as needed.
  2. 🔎 Real-Time Change Detection: Automatically track every tweak in Figma, highlighting modified or removed text layers for quick review.
  3. 👥 Collaborative Updates: Every team member with the plugin sees changes in the file, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.
  4. ⏪ Complete Version History: Access a full log of edits anytime, and revert to previous versions in a click — ideal for instant rollbacks or detailed audits.
  5. 🏷️ Easy Status Labeling: Use four statuses (Progress, Done, Rejected, Dev) to clearly show where each piece of text stands.
  6. 🚀 Developer Mode: Give developers a clean interface showing only finalized content, with one-click copying and preserved formatting.
  7. 🌐 Smart Organization: Search and filter text by status, date, or keywords, with items neatly grouped by frames for instant clarity.
  8. 🎨 Adaptive UI: Switch between light and dark themes, and toggle to a compact layout when you need to save screen space—always keeping things clear and intuitive.


Keep your text workflow efficient, organized, and worry-free. ContentFlow ensures designers, writers, and developers stay perfectly synced with minimal fuss and maximum productivity!
plugins.tagline: A collaborative text manager to track updates, organize content, and streamline dev handoff.

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description:
Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.


Features:

  1. Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.
  2. List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.
  3. Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.
  4. Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.


Why I Created It:

I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.


Use Cases:

  1. Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.
  2. Quickly jump between components and your working frames.
  3. Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

plugins.name: The Settler — localizer for external (or missing) alias variables
plugins.description:
(Русский внизу 👇)

en:

This plugin localises all alias variables that refer to missing base variables (those located in external files or simply deleted)

🎦 Video demonstration: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk


Why is this a problem?! Figma doesn't care about these links, it doesn't transfer them to the new file, but leaves the links to the companion variables (base/master variables) in the old file. And this isn't what you expect when you copy variables :)


In simple words, what the plugin does:

  1. It looks for alias variables that have a reference to base variables that didn't make it to this file (either left in another file or simply missing)
  2. Creates copies of such variables in this file
  3. Rebinds the alias variable, changing the reference from the external master variable (base variable) to the newly created local one


Works for variables of all types:

  1. color,
  2. text,
  3. boolean,
  4. numeric

It should work with multiple mods, but I haven't tested this part.


ru:

Плагин поможет, когда вы взяли и "тупа" скопировали переменные из другого файла, а там были алиасы (переменные ссылались на другие переменные).

🎦 Видео-демонстрация: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk

Но вот незадача! Figma не заботиться об этих связях, она не переносит их в новый файл, а оставляет ссылки на переменные-спутники (базовые/мастер-переменные) в старом файле. А это вообще не то, чего ждёшь, когда копируешь переменные :)


Простыми словами, что делает плагин:

  1. Ищет переменные-алиасы, которые ссылаются на базовые переменные, не дошедшие до этого файла (либо оставшиеся в другом файле, либо пропавшие без вести)
  2. Создает копии таких переменных в этом файле
  3. Перевязывает алиас-переменную, меняя ссылку с внешней мастер-переменной (базовой переменной) на локальную


Работает для переменных всех типов:

  1. цветовые,
  2. текстовые,
  3. булевы,
  4. числовые


По идее, должно работает и с множественными модами, но я не тестил этот момент

accepted.name: Studio The
accepted.description:
The UX/UI designer,
The Motion designer

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows

plugins.name: DT组件筛选 DT Component Selector
plugins.description:
Introduction:

The DT Component Selector plugin is a Figma tool designed to quickly filter and locate DT components in your design. This plugin helps designers improve their workflow by efficiently identifying and managing DT components in complex layouts.


Function Description:

  1. Filters all components in the selected frame that match the DT component criteria.
  2. Categorizes components into those visible on the canvas and those outside the visible bounds.
  3. Supports quick location of selected components for further manipulation.


How to Use:

  1. Select a frame and click the "Show Component Filter" button.
  2. The plugin will automatically filter the qualifying DT components, displaying the results as visible and non-visible components.
  3. Click the "Locate" button next to a component to quickly locate it in your design.


Notes:

  1. The plugin filters only DT components that match predefined criteria, ignoring other types.
  2. Make sure to select a frame for the plugin to function correctly.


介绍：

DT组件筛选插件是一款用于快速筛选并定位设计中的DT组件的Figma插件。该插件旨在提高设计师在处理复杂设计时的工作效率，帮助用户更快速地找到并操作DT组件。


功能说明：

  1. 筛选出当前画板中符合DT组件定义的所有组件。
  2. 可对组件进行分类：在画板可见范围内和不可见范围内的组件。
  3. 支持快速定位所选组件，并进行进一步操作。


使用方法：

  1. 选择一个画板并点击“显示组件筛选”按钮。
  2. 插件会自动筛选符合条件的DT组件，结果将分为可见组件和不可见组件进行展示。
  3. 点击组件名称旁的“定位”按钮即可快速定位到该组件。


注意事项：

  1. 插件仅会筛选符合预定义条件的DT组件，其他组件将被忽略。
  2. 请确保您选择的是一个画板，否则插件将无法运行。

accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Quickly filter and locate DT components in your design

plugins.name: Background Color Generator
plugins.description:
Summary:

This plugin is ideal for B2B products where you want to integrate a client’s branding color into background designs while maintaining accessibility and strong visual contrast.


How to use:

Pick a color using the hue slider or a HEX code. Select the layer you want to apply the color to, then simply click the button to apply it. The plugin generates light and dark variations with the same hue.


Accessibility Compliance:

This plugin follows the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for color contrast:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.
  3. For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.
  4. The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.


(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
plugins.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

plugins.name: Stellar - Streamline Your Design Handoff
plugins.description:
Stellar 🚀 empowers you to create organized and professional documentation for your design handoff. With four robust tools, you can structure your Figma files in a clean and intuitive manner.


Frame Identifier - Ideal for pinpointing specific screens or components.

Easily create clear headers to identify individual frames:

  1. Select any frame or group of elements.
  2. Add a title and subtitle.
  3. A polished header will be generated above your selection, enhancing clarity and organization.


Section Identifier - Perfect for grouping features or user flows.

Organize related frames with cohesive section headers:

  1. Select multiple frames that belong together.
  2. Add a section title and description.
  3. A header will be created that spans across all selected frames, providing a unified view.


Flow Identifier - Essential for tracking progress and communicating state.

Document your navigation flows with intuitive status indicators:

  1. Select frames within your user flow.
  2. Add a title and description.
  3. Choose a status (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Development).
  4. Status tags are color-coded and include helpful icons, making it easy to convey the current state.



Connector Arrows - Connect your frames with intelligent arrows.

Seamlessly link frames with dynamic arrows:

  1. Select two or more frames to connect.
  2. Choose from 4 arrow styles: Default Arrow (clean and simple), Success Arrow (positive flows), Error Arrow (error states), Dashed Arrow (alternative paths).
  3. Toggle between light and dark modes for optimal visibility.
  4. Arrows automatically adjust to frame positions, ensuring a tidy and logical layout.


Perfect for:

  1. Design Systems
  2. User Flow Documentation
  3. Development Handoff
  4. Project Status Tracking
  5. Team Collaboration



Start organizing your Figma files with Stellar and create documentation that both designers and developers will appreciate! 🚀🚀🚀
plugins.tagline: Streamline your design handoff with organized headers, sections, and smart connectors

新增了对figma工具中绘制的多边形的支持(仅支持正多边形，即绘制时边界框宽度高度相同)；

由于算法不同，多边形修改圆角类型后和矩形略有差异，具体表现为，插件会给多边形一个autolayout，同时锁定内部多边形，此时选中autolayout即可修改内部多边形。

How it Works: When a polygon's corner style is modified, it will be wrapped in a locked Auto Layout frame. To continue making edits with the plugin, simply select this new Auto Layout frame.

plugins.name: Fancy Figma to Bricks builder
plugins.description:
Forget doing things twice — design smarter by managing your variables, color palette and designs in Figma, then effortlessly transfer everything into Bricks builder with just a few clicks.


Plugin video: https://youtu.be/5_52ZX3yfGQ


Website: https://fancyframework.com/figma-plugin/


Purchase an early adopter license for 10 instances*: BUY NOW

Documentation: https://fancyframework.com/docs/

Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/fancybricks

YouTube: https://youtube.com/@fancybricks


* An instance refers to each individual installation of the software, whether on different devices or platforms. For example, if you activate the license on the desktop app and also use it on the web version, even with the same user account, it will count as two separate instances.


How it works?


Fancy Framework for Figma streamlines your workflow in three simple steps — from defining your design system in Figma to building real pages in Bricks. Here’s how:


Set up your design variables in Figma

Define your entire design system directly in Figma — colors, typography, spacing, and more. Group and name your variables for better clarity and consistency across your designs.


Export your variables and color palette to Bricks

With just a few clicks, convert your Figma variables into Bricks-compatible values. Keep your color system consistent across design and development — no need to manually recreate anything.


Copy from Figma, paste into Bricks

Select any Auto Layout section in Figma, copy it, and paste it directly into the Bricks editor. Supports autolayout, semantic tags, classes, grids and native Bricks elements — just like you designed it.


Main features

Fancy Figma to bricks builder plugin gives you everything you need to streamline your workflow: organize design variables, export color palettes, and paste fully structured sections directly into Bricks. No more duplicated effort — just clean, scalable, and efficient web design.


Advanced variable support

Use calc, rem, number and clamp() directly in your Figma variables for greater flexibility and control.


Auto-generate color variations

Generate transparent, darkened, and lightened versions of your colors instantly — no need to create them manually. Perfect for building accessible and consistent UI systems.


Export dynamic variables to Bricks

Thanks to support for clamp, calc, rem, and numeric operations, your Figma variables are ready for real-world usage inside Bricks — no tweaks needed.


Bricks-ready color palette export

Automatically export your color palette from Figma, linked directly to your variables — ready to import into Bricks and use seamlessly across your entire site.


Seamless copy-paste from Figma to Bricks

Copy any section built with Auto Layout in Figma and paste it directly into Bricks — layout structure, classes, and semantic tags all preserved.


Copy-Paste Features


Built for Auto Layout

By following best practices, your sections will copy perfectly into Bricks — layout, spacing, and hierarchy intact. Check out my free figma course: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbc4J3wWyVcdnL9A_UA-WdE2tXRUW-I8O


Semantic HTML tag support

Your Figma sections can include semantic tags like [section], [container], [ul], [li], [h1–h6], [p], [span], and more. Perfect for SEO, accessibility, and clean markup.


Support for display grid

Display grid support uses (grid-x) (grid-x-x) to apply display: grid in Bricks automatically when pasting.


Class-friendly workflow

Use meaningful class names in Figma and watch them transfer seamlessly into Bricks. Combine with utility classes for maximum flexibility and control.


Bricks-native element compatibility

Paste sections that automatically map to Bricks' native elements like:

  1. Buttons
  2. Links
  3. SVG
  4. Forms
  5. Tabs
  6. Accordions
  7. Nav menu
  8. Logo
  9. Counters
  10. Breadcrumbs
  11. Filter search
  12. Filter checkbox
  13. More will be added
plugins.tagline: The ultimate web design workflow for Bricks Builder

plugins.name: Frameverse
plugins.description:
Frameverse - Share Frames Seamlessly


Frameverse is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes design sharing. Generate secure tokens for your frames and assets, allowing instant access across teams and continents. Share specific design elements without exposing your entire file, maintaining control while enabling seamless collaboration.



✨ Key Features


- One-Click Sharing: Select any frame, section, or slice and generate a shareable token instantly

- Smart Import: Paste a token to import frames with perfect fidelity, maintaining all properties including:

- Layout structures and constraints

- Shapes and component instances

- Vector paths and effects

- Fonts and text styles

- Images and fills


- Batch Operations: Share or import multiple frames at once

- Preview Panel: Visual preview of selected frames before sharing



🎯 Perfect For


- Design System Teams sharing component updates

- Agencies sharing design patterns with clients

- Product Teams maintaining consistent layouts across files

- Anyone looking to transfer frames between files without manual recreation



💡 How It Works


1. Select the frames you want to share

2. Click "Generate Token" to create a unique share code

3. Share the token with your team

4. Recipients paste the token to import frames with all properties intact (Eg: YJS-hoo)



🔒 Security & Performance


- Tokens are temporary and expire after 24 hours

- No data persistence - files are fully purged after token expiration

- Share specific frames without exposing entire files

- Intelligent compression and processing for optimal performance

- Progressive loading for larger frames



No account required. Start sharing frames in seconds!



Questions or feedback? Contact us
plugins.tagline: Exchange assets with the most intuitive frame sharing solution for Figma

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description:
Design-to-code, simplified


Eggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes don’t disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.


Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to code—no developer implementation needed.


Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.


For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.


How It Works

  1. Connect to your GitHub repo.
  2. Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.
  3. When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.
  4. Review, then click to create a pull request.
  5. A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.


Current Status

Eggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.


Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.


Need some help?

Check out our Getting Started Guide.


Need more help?

Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.com


Need pros to help design & build your design system or app? That’s Bitovi!
